column5: As Red Green often said, remember we're all in this together...https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/north...yu1Feu3h2p3MfM

Thanks Gord. We sometimes fail to remember we are all humans and boundaries are nothing more then a line on a map. The story illustrates a story between two humans and has nothing to do with Americans & Canadians. Nice Thanksgiving read.
Yes x2 nice story for a change

The good folks in this world (and there are a lot of them) tend to just go about doing what is right and seldom give it a thought, let alone making the news. We only hear the bad stuff on the nightly news. Refreshing to say the least. Thanks for posting. Pooch
Thatâ€™s a great story, thanks for posting.
Thumbs up to that man for volunteering and helping that family out, true kindness. The husband should be Articled XV for having his wife n kids drive from Georgia to Alaska this time of year.
I am always up for a road trip!

I was thinking the same thing. But then if you have not been out of the southland, things like snow do not cross your mind I guess. Good grief, the sudden slap of reality is a harsh teacher. Good thing there are some "special people" around to help shepherd the clueless. In 2001 I drove that same route, I would NOT want to do that in the winter.
